DOC.brief_summary: In an open-label feasibility study, fifteen will be recruited to participate in the study from among those who have already chosen of their own accord to undergo ECT (standard of care) at Yale Psychiatric Hospital for treatment of a depressive episode. These patients will receive computer-assisted cognitive behavior therapy (CCBT).
DOC.brief_title: Computerized Cognitive Behavioral Therapy and Electroconvulsive Therapy
DOC.criteria: 1875 years old meet DSM5 criteria for depressive episodes able to use a computer diagnosis of an axis II (personality disorder) active suicidal thoughts with a plan current substance use disorder nonaffective psychosis prior treatment with ECT in the past 6 months CBT treatment in the past 12 months dementia delirium or another other neurological or mental disease that might affect cognition or the ability to meaningfully participate in computerized CBT
